name: Remy Russell
summary: Understand the users, buyers, and the problems worth solving to ensure success of the business. Inspire cross-functional collaboration to align on the most promising strategies. Drive the execution of the vision through rapid iteration of discovery and delivery

professionalExperience.description: Product Lead for a Case Management platform used by social service providers (Homeless Management, Medically Tailored Meals, Behavioral Health, and more)
highlights: Analyzed integration partner APIs and partnered with engineering to design the best solutions to extend user capabilities and enable growth

Gained experience delivering or scrapping POCs and MVPs, often to extend platform capabilities by integrating with third parties (e.g., Twilio for Email & SMS, Onfleet and WorkWave for last-mile delivery operations, Health Information Exchanges, Medicaid Payers, Claims Processing Systems, etc.)
Partnered with Sales, Client Success, and Implementation teams to establish and maintain the roadmap, define KPIs, and create mechanisms to measure & communicate priority and progress
achievements: Helped drive growth in ARR by over 50% by expanding platform capabilities, ultimately leading to Eccovia's acquisition
Shipped a new RESTful API from 0 to 1 and onboarded over 10 customer organizations to start using it for their custom integration use cases
Helped establish a clear product catalog and a platform-based, microservice approach to enable growth/expansion across multiple customers on the platform

professionalExperience.position: Business Analyst, Solutions Delivery and Integrations
professionalExperience.description: Led problem discovery and requirements gathering with new customers during the initial design and implementation of their solution on the case management platform.
highlights: Drove the iterative discovery/delivery process for complex data migration efforts, custom integration solutions, and facilitated UAT and post-go-live support
achievements: Successfully implemented new solutions for two of Eccovia's top ten largest customers by ARR

Took ownership of all new integration use cases (over a dozen), and after finding patterns/similarities, advocated for and started designing agnostic services to support multiple customers or integration partners
Drove the platform's evolution to unlock the capabilities requested by our customers (e.g., scheduled exports, API access to storage accounts, generic and purpose-built RESTful endpoints, etc.)

professionalExperience.position: Business Analyst II, MMIS Implementation Project
professionalExperience.description: Worked with internal team and stakeholders from the Utah Department of Health on system migration and gap analysis activities for implementation of a new Medicaid Management Information System to replace the legacy MMIS
highlights: Partnered with the State customer stakeholders to define and document comprehensive design details for the Provider Enrollment Subsystem (to guide development and testing)

professionalExperience.description: Learned the end-to-end functionality of CNSIâ€™s 'Electronic Medicaid Incentive Payment Program' solution and re-authored technical system design documentation to comply with UML standards
highlights: Analyzed program mandates published by the Center for Medicaid Services to design and implement compliant functionality

education.degree: BSE in Industrial & Operations Engineering, Certificate in Entrepreneurship 2015

coreSkills: Problem-solving and ownership of complex challenges
Ability to articulate both technical details and high-level strategy to varying types of stakeholders
Quick learner of new tools, technologies, and methodologies
Proficiency in SQL and ability to read and understand most programming languages, particularly since incorporating LLMs into my toolkit

Healhcare Interoperability experience including HL7 fundamentals (v2.x and FHIR) with v2.x ADT and Revenue Cycle Management integrations for Medicaid eligibility checks and claim submissioin/remittance (X12 EDI Standards)
toolsAndFrameworks: Roadmapping and Sprint Planning (Atlassian Jira Plans, MS Project, ProductBoard)
Insight collection/consolidation (Hubspot, Atlassian Jira Discovery, ProductBoard, Microsoft Forms, Teams, Azure Dashboards, SQL, etc)
Documentation, Training, and Releases (HelpJuice, Microsoft Stream, Atlassian Confluence and Jiral Release features, ReleaseNotes.io)
Designing, Diagramming, & Brainstorming (Confluence Whiteboards, Lucidchart, Vizio, FigJam, LLMs)
No or low-code API Testing (Postman, Microsoft Power Automate, Zapier)
Dual-track Agile, Scrum (Jira Boards for backlog refinement, Kanban, sprint planning, release planning, etc.)
fun: Outdoor activities (skiing, mountain biking, hiking, camping)
Podcasts/audiobooks on anything related to tech, health, or science related
